articles.title: Kim Jong Il Enjoys Performance Given by State Merited Chorus
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Enjoys Performance Given by State Merited Chorus
 Pyongyang, July 27 (KCNA) -- Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, enjoyed a performance given by the State Merited Chorus on the occasion of the 58th anniversary of the victory of the Korean people in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 Warmly acknowledging the enthusiastic cheers of the audience, he heartily congratulated them on the war victory day.
					
					 Its repertoire included male chorus "Song Devoted to Marshal Kim Il Sung", orchestral music and male chorus "Pass Mungyong", male chorus "Song of a Truck Driver", female solo and male chorus "Nobody Knows", male solo and male chorus "For My Only Motherland", collection of songs "We Are Going in for the Care of the Leader", "Where Are You, Dear General" and "O, What Type of Man Is Party Member" from the revolutionary opera "A Story of a Nurse" and male chorus "Road of Victory".
					
					 The performers sang high praises of the shining feats the army and people of the DPRK performed by beating back the U.S.-led imperialist allied forces for the first time in history and honorably defending the freedom and independence of the country under the wise leadership of President Kim Il Sung. They successfully represented the faith and pledge of all the servicepersons to turn the cheers of war victory into fireworks of victory for national reunification under the leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 They, at the same time, powerfully demonstrated the fighting spirit of the strong revolutionary army of Mt. Paektu to mercilessly wipe out the U.S. imperialists and the confrontation maniacs keen to ignite a new war with the might of the Songun arms and defend the socialist country as firm as a rock if they dare intrude even an inch of the sky, land and seas of the inviolable country.
					
					 Waving to the enthusiastically cheering performers and audience, Kim Jong Il congratulated the performers on their successful performance.
					
					 Greatly satisfied with the splendid performance given by the chorus, he highly praised the performers for their successful performance and thanked them.
					
					 Among the audience were senior officials of party and armed forces organs Kim Jong Un, Choe Yong Rim, Ri Yong Ho, Kim Yong Chun, Kim Ki Nam, Choe Thae Bok, Jang Song Thaek, Kim Jong Gak, Choe Ryong Hae, Pak To Chun, Kim Yong Il, Kim Yang Gon, Thae Jong Su, Kim Phyong Hae, Mun Kyong Dok, Ju Kyu Chang, U Tong Chuk, Kim Chang Sop and Ri Myong Su, Members of the Central Military Commission of the WPK Kim Kyong Ok, Kim Myong Guk, Kim Won Hong, Jong Myong Do, Ri Pyong Chol, Kim Yong Chol and Yun Jong Rin and Department Director of the NDC Hyon Chol Hae.

articles.title: Banquet Given by WPK Central Military Commission and DPRK NDC
articles.content:
Banquet Given by WPK Central Military Commission and DPRK NDC 
 Pyongyang, July 27 (KCNA) -- The Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea and the National Defence Commission of the DPRK gave a banquet on Wednesday, the 58th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War.
					 Present there on invitation was Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the WPK and chairman of the DPRK NDC.
					
					 Warmly acknowledging the enthusiastic cheers of the participants, he heartily congratulated them on the war victory day.
					
					 Ri Yong Ho made a speech at the banquet.
					
					 Present there were Kim Jong Un and Ri Yong Ho, vice-chairmen of the Central Military Commission of the WPK, Kim Yong Chun, Kim Ki Nam, Choe Thae Bok, Jang Song Thaek, Choe Ryong Hae, Kim Jong Gak, U Tong Chuk, Kim Chang Sop, Thae Jong Su, Mun Kyong  Dok and others of the Political Bureau of the WPK Central Committee, members of the Central Military Commission of the WPK and officials of the NDC, armed forces organs and literary, art and media organizations.

articles.title: Sends Wreath to Bier of Kim Chang Sik
articles.content:
Sends Wreath to Bier of Kim Chang Sik
 Pyongyang, July 27 (KCNA) -- General secretary Kim Jong Il Wednesday sent a wreath to the bier of Kim Chang Sik, People's Journalist of Rodong Sinmun, expressing deep condolences over his death.

articles.title: Floral Baskets Laid before Statues
articles.content:
Floral Baskets Laid before Statues  
 Pyongyang, July 27 (KCNA) -- Floral baskets were placed before the statues of President Kim Il Sung across the country by servicepersons of the Korean People's Army, people from all walks of life and school youth and children on the 58th anniversary of the victory won by the Korean people in the great Fatherland Liberation War.
					 They visited the President's statues standing at Kim Il Sung University, Kim Il Sung Military University, the Ministry of People's Security, Pyongyang Students and Children's Palace and other places in the capital. 
					
					 Floral baskets were placed in the name of the party, armed forces and power bodies and social organizations and ministries, national institutions, units of the Korean People's Army and the Korean People's Internal Security Forces, institutions of science, education, culture and art, public health and media, industrial establishments, farms, schools and others.
					
					 Visitors paid tribute to the President in humble reverence.
					
					 Servicepersons, working people and school youth and children in different parts of the country placed floral baskets, bunches of flowers and flowers before the statues of the President in their residential areas.

articles.title: Conclusion of Peace Agreement Called for: KCNA Commentary
articles.content:
Conclusion of Peace Agreement Called for: KCNA Commentary 
 Pyongyang, July 27 (KCNA) -- 58 years have passed since the Armistice Agreement (AA) was signed on July 27, 1953. 
					 The fragile state of armistice has always barred the peaceful solution of the Korean issue and seriously hamstrung the efforts to realize the denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula for several decades. 
					
					 When a historic review is made of the agreements related to armistice, all the agreements concluded among countries during World War I were replaced by peace agreements in a matter of six months to two years and those signed as regards the end of World War II were also replaced by peace agreements (peace treaties) in a matter of several years or within ten years at the longest.
					
					 However, the AA, the leftover of the Korean War, has lasted for nearly six decades. 
					
					 The state of armistice is like a time bomb threatening the security in East Asia and the rest of the Asia-Pacific region. 
					
					 There is nowhere else in the world such region fraught with danger where huge strategic armed forces are deployed and military actions such as joint war exercises are daily occurrences. 
					
					 The perilous nature of ceasefire on the peninsula is evidenced by hundreds of meetings of the Military Armistice Commission held to handle hundreds of thousands of cases of violation of the AA. 
					
					 The touch-and-go situation always prevailing in the Asia-Pacific region, the strategic center in the new century, neither conforms with the trend of the era towards peace nor does anyone good.
					
					 This abnormal situation should not be allowed to go on in every aspect. 
					
					 It is necessary to end the ceasefire between the DPRK and the U.S. and establish a peace-keeping mechanism in order to put an end to the confrontation and conflicts and ensure durable peace and security on the Korean Peninsula, the biggest hotspot of the region.
					
					 Concluding a peace agreement may be the first step for settling the Korean issue including the denuclearization. 
					
					 A series of negotiations including the six-party talks for the denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula underwent twists and turns in the past due to the failure to properly understand that the establishment of a peace-keeping mechanism is essential for settling the Korean issue. 
					
					 It is impossible to wipe out the mutual distrust nor is it possible to achieve a smooth solution of the issue of denuclearization as long as there persists the hostile relationship between the DPRK and the U.S., the signatories to the AA, the relationship in which they level their guns at each other. This is the lesson drawn from the process of the six-party talks. 
					
					 It is the keynote of the DPRK's proposal for concluding a peace agreement to scrap the armistice mechanism which has systematically deteriorated the hostile relations between the two countries, build confidence and step up the process of denuclearization. 
					
					 Being a curtain-raiser to confidence-building, the conclusion of a peace agreement will provide an institutional guarantee for wiping out the bilateral distrust and opening the relations of mutual respect and equality. 
					
					 No country has heavier responsibility than the U.S. in replacing the AA by a peace agreement. 
					
					 The AA is the leftover of the Cold War through which the U.S. sought to impose the American-style view on value and system on other countries. The U.S. has so far interfered in the internal affairs of Korea as the direct party concerned of the AA and exercised the right to military control over south Korea. 
					
					 The U.S. should fulfill its historic responsibility for ensuring peace on the peninsula. 
					
					 The peninsula is now standing at the crossroads of detente and vicious cycle of escalating tension. This situation requires the parties concerned not to miss the opportunity of dialogue but make a bold decision to deal with the fundamental issue. 
					
					 The issue of ensuring peace on the peninsula will find a smooth solution if the U.S. properly judges the changed situation and the trend of developing history and make a bold political decision to bring about a switchover in its DPRK policy to meet its interests and the aspiration of the world peace-loving people. 
					
					 Doing so is not an issue of one party giving any benefit to the other party or making reward to it. This would be a fruitful political issue of doing the DPRK and the U.S. and the international community good and making a substantial contribution to the development of peace in the world. 
					
					 How to approach the issue of concluding a peace agreement will be a touchstone showing whether the U.S. styling itself an Asia-Pacific nation has the will to play a responsible role in solving urgent pending political problems in the region including the denuclearization of the peninsula or not.

articles.title: 6 Million People Visited War Memorial Tower for 18 Yrs
articles.content:
6 Million People Visited War Memorial Tower for 18 Yrs 
 Pyongyang, July 27 (KCNA) -- The Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Memorial Tower has been visited by an endless stream of servicepersons, working people, youth and students on the occasion of the war victory day.
					 The tower, built on the 40th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the war, comprehensively shows the feats performed by the army and people in defending the country under the wise leadership of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 A total of more than 6 million people of over 44 600 organizations visited the tower for 18 years since its completion.
					
					 The visitors recollected with deep emotion the feats by the President who shattered the myth of the "mightiness" of the U.S. imperialists who boasted of the numerical and technological advantages and brought about the beginning of a downhill turn for them with his Juche-based military idea, superb strategies and tactics and original military war methods.
					
					 They went round the monument to the President's autograph, the monument to the poem and the main sculpture "Victory".
					
					 Visitors also included many overseas Koreans and foreigners.

articles.title: Wreaths and Floral Baskets Laid before Martyrs' Cemeteries and Monuments
articles.content:
Wreaths and Floral Baskets Laid before Martyrs' Cemeteries and Monuments
 Pyongyang, July 27 (KCNA) -- Wreaths and floral baskets were laid before the Revolutionary Martyrs Cemetery on Mt. Taesong, the Patriotic Martyrs Cemetery and the Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Memorial Tower with due ceremonies on July 27 on the 58th anniversary of the victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War. 
					 Seen at the wreath-laying stands of the cemeteries were wreaths sent by Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army. 
					
					 Attending the ceremonies were senior party, army and state officials, the chairperson of a friendly party, officials of the party, armed forces and power bodies, public organizations, ministries and national institutions, servicepersons of the KPA and the Korean People's Internal Security Forces and working people. 
					
					 Wreaths in the name of the Central Committee of the WPK, the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly and Cabinet of the DPRK were laid at the stands of the cemeteries. A floral basket in the joint name of the Central Committee and the Central Military Commission of the WPK was laid before the main sculpture "Victory" of the memorial tower. 
					
					 Also laid were wreaths and floral baskets in the name of the Ministry of the People's Armed Forces, the Ministry of People's Security, public organizations, ministries, national institutions, units of the KPA and the Korean People's Internal Security Forces, scientific, educational, public health and media institutions, party and power bodies and farms in Pyongyang. 
					
					 Meanwhile, wreaths were laid before the statues of martyrs, the Monuments to the Fallen Fighters of the KPA, cemeteries and graves of martyrs across the country. 
					
					 The military attaches corps here visited the Revolutionary Martyrs Cemetery on Mt. Taesong and the Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Memorial Tower on the same day to lay a wreath and a floral basket.

articles.title: Dancing Parties Held
articles.content:
Dancing Parties Held
 Pyongyang, July 27 (KCNA) -- Dancing parties of youth and students took place in different parts of the DPRK on Wednesday to celebrate the 58th anniversary of the victory of the Korean people in the great Fatherland Liberation War.
					 The dancing parties started as the song "Long Live Generalissimo Kim Il Sung" resounded forth. Their venues included Pyongyang, Phyongsong, Wonsan and Hamhung Cities.
					
					 Reflected in the faces of the dancers were deep thanks and reverence for President Kim Il Sung who defeated the imperialist aggression forces and demonstrated the spirit and might of heroic Korea to the whole world with his outstanding military idea, stratagem and prominent art of command.
					
					 They presented beautiful dances to the tune of songs "Our Victory-Day July 27" and "Ours Is the Song of Victory".
					
					 They reflected their great pride and self-esteem of being blessed with illustrious leaders generation after generation as they are led by Kim Jong Il in their enthusiastic dances to the tune of such songs as "Let's Sing of Our Pride in Being under the Guidance of the General" and "Our General Is the Best".

articles.title: Art Performances Celebrate Day of War Victory
articles.content:
Art Performances Celebrate Day of War Victory 
 Pyongyang, July 27 (KCNA) -- A concert was given by artistes of the Samjiyon Band of the Mansudae Art Troupe at the People's Palace of Culture on Wednesday to celebrate the 58th anniversary of the great victory won by the Korean people in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 Among the audience were senior state officials, officials of the party, armed forces and power bodies, working people's organizations, ministries, national institutions and servicepersons of the Korean People's Army and the Korean People's Internal Security Forces and working people in the city.  
					
					 Overseas Koreans and the chief of the Pyongyang mission of the Anti-Imperialist National Democratic Front, diplomatic envoys of different countries and military attaches of foreign embassies and representatives of international bodies here were invited there.
					
					 The performance helped the audience recollect with warm feelings the immortal exploits performed by President Kim Il Sung who led the war to victory with the Juche-based military idea and outstanding commanding art, defeating the U.S. imperialists and glorifying Korea as a heroic country. The concert left deep impressions on the audience. 
					
					 Put on the stage were serial wartime songs "Song of National Defence", "Forward Advance" and "To a Decisive Battle", a mixed duet "Mill on Jictong Ridge for Victory ", women's instrumental music "Mungyong Pass", and others. The numbers showed well the feats of the servicepersons of the People's Army who defended the land of the country at the cost of their blood and people who dedicated their all to boosting the wartime production and assisting those on the front.
					
					 Celebration performances also took place in Pyongyang and local areas on the same day. 
					
					 The National Symphony Orchestra performed at the Moranbong Theatre and the National Folk Art Troupe, the Orchestra of the Yun I Sang Music Institute and other art troupes at the Yun I Sang Concert Hall. Drama "We Will Recollect Today" was performed at the National Theatre. 
					
					 Colorful performances given in South Hamgyong, Jagang and Kangwon provinces also added to the festive atmosphere.

articles.title: Commendations Awarded Artistes and Officials of Unhasu Orchestra
articles.content:
Commendations Awarded Artistes and Officials of Unhasu Orchestra
 Pyongyang, July 27 (KCNA) -- Commendations were awarded to officials, creators and artistes of the Unhasu Orchestra. They have registered peculiar successes in the creation of concerts to meet the daily increasing ideological and emotional requirements and desire of the people in the Songun era by successfully embodying the idea of the Workers' Party of Korea on creating music of the new century in the DPRK. They have thus greatly contributed to arousing the army and people to accomplishing the revolutionary cause of Juche. 
					 Kim Il Sung Prize was awarded to Jang Jo Il and Kim Il Sung Youth Honor Prize to four others. 
					
					 The titles of People's Actor and People's Actress were awarded to three persons, the title of Merited Artiste to six and the titles of Merited Actor and Merited Actress to seven. 
					
					 The Order of Labor, Orders of National Flag Second and Third Class and Medal of Merit went to 74. 
					
					 A decree of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly on awarding the commendations was issued on Wednesday.

articles.title: Lao Military Delegation Here
articles.content:
Lao Military Delegation Here
 Pyongyang, July 27 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the General Staff of the Laotian People's Army led by Chief Sanyahak Phomvihane arrived here Wednesday. 
					 A ceremony to welcome the delegation took place in front of the Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Memorial Tower. 
					
					 The Ministry of the People's Armed Forces hosted a reception in honor of the delegation.

articles.title: British Travel Company to Launch Korea Tourism
articles.content:
British Travel Company to Launch Korea Tourism
						
 Pyongyang, July 27 (KCNA) -- VOA introduced a British travel company's Korea tourism program on July 15.
					 The Political Tours announced that the first tourist group would enter north Korea on October 15, accompanied by UK's first charge d'affaires ad interim to Pyongyang, James Edward Hoare, the radio said, adding:
					
					 During ten days of tourism, the ex-charge d'affaires plans to explain to the tourists the culture and political situation of north Korea and the experience he gained during his career as a diplomat. 
					
					 Nicolas Wood, who founded the Political Tours early this year, gave the reason why he chose north Korea as a tourist destination. His plan is to open a way of getting experience at first hand in the country drawing international interest, not only through media reports. 
					
					 In north Korea the tourists will make a round of Pyongyang and other major tourist attractions. They will also visit factories in Hamhung city, Songdowon International Children's Camp and University of Agriculture in Wonsan city and other places.
					
					 The Political Tours is said to get many inquiries about north Korea tourism.
					
					 Wood said he would decide whether to continue such tourism program on a regular basis after taking the tourists' opinions about their tourism mainly aimed to get a good understanding of the region's situation.

articles.title: Anti-U.S. Action in S. Korea for Peace Agreement
articles.content:
Anti-U.S. Action in S. Korea for Peace Agreement
						
 Pyongyang, July 27 (KCNA) -- The People for Achieving Peace and Reunification, the Solidarity for Progress and the Confederation of Trade Unions in south Korea called for the conclusion of a peace agreement on the Korean Peninsula. They held a rally in Seoul on July 24.
					 The participants deplored in a resolution that peace has not yet come in the peninsula though 58 years have passed since the armistice agreement was signed.
					
					 They denounced the U.S. for inciting military tension and confrontation and laying hurdles in the way of achieving the independent and peaceful reunification of the Korean nation.
					
					 They called upon all the people to get united for the conclusion of the peace agreement, the withdrawal of the U.S. forces from south Korea and the breakdown of the military alliance for aggression with the U.S.
					
					 The organizations staged an anti-U.S. action outside the U.S. military base in Ryongsan.
					
					 The participants pasted on the wall of the military base a large suspension poster bearing letters "Withdrawal of U.S. Forces from South Korea", "Conclusion of Peace Agreement" and "U.S. Forces, Make an Apology for their Crimes" and let fly a resolution into the base.

articles.title: Newspapers Mark War Victory Day
articles.content:
Newspapers Mark War Victory Day 
 Pyongyang, July 27 (KCNA) -- Today is the 58th anniversary of the historic victory the army and people of the DPRK won after defeating the U.S. imperialist aggressors who boasted of being the "strongest" in the world. 
					 Newspapers Wednesday dedicate editorials to the anniversary. They call for steadily glorifying the history and tradition of the victory. 
					
					 Rodong Sinmun says the Fatherland Liberation War proved that the army and people determined to defend their idea, system and cause at the cost of their lives under the leadership of the great illustrious commander will always emerge victorious. 
					
					 The victory in the war was a shining fruition of the Juche-oriented military idea, tactics and distinguished commanding art of President Kim Il Sung, the paper says, and goes on:
					
					 The President beat off the aggressors' sudden invasion with immediate counterattack and pushed the enemies superior in forces into a position of passive defensive with successive offensive and actively led the war to victory. The world history of war has never known such an outstanding strategist and invincible and iron-willed commander as the President. 
					
					 As the President led the war to victory the Korean people could defend the precious country that was liberated through the hard-fought struggle and demonstrate the dignity of the heroic people who defeated the imperialist allied forces. 
					
					 The history of war victory attained by the President has been successfully carried forward generation after generation thanks to Kim Jong Il, peerless and brilliant commander of Songun.
					
					 Thanks to his outstanding wisdom and commanding art, the Korean People's Army has grown to be the invincible revolutionary army, the single-minded unity of the people has been strengthened thousand-folds and the country had access to strong war deterrence and turned into an impregnable fortress. 
					
					 Minju Joson says it is a great pride of the army and people of the DPRK to have the shining history of war victory gained under the leadership of the great leader and the great party. The DPRK under the banner of Songun will always emerge victorious, it adds.

articles.title: KCTU Confirms New Action Program
articles.content:
KCTU Confirms New Action Program
 Pyongyang, July 27 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions held a meeting at its conference room on July 22 and confirmed its future action program.
					 It set the intensive action period from July 25 to August 13 and underlined the need to check the conclusion of the Free Trade Agreement with the U.S., get the south Korea-U.S. SOFA revised and stop the authorities' fascist suppression.
					
					 The organization would stage a big action with workers across south Korea with August 15 as a momentum, the action program said.
					
					 It would form a vanguard for regional reunification, an action group and a marchers group to stage anti-U.S. actions including the opposition to the construction of Jeju naval base and probe into the truth about the crimes related to the burial of defoliant, it stressed.
					
					 KCTU would have all the people turn out in the action to get part-time jobs abolished, foil the suppression of the labor movement, win the basic right to labor and punish the "Grand National Party", it added.

articles.title: Thoroughgoing Investigation into U.S. Forces' Burial of Defoliant Demanded
articles.content:
Thoroughgoing Investigation into U.S. Forces' Burial of Defoliant Demanded
 Pyongyang, July 27 (KCNA) -- Representatives of south Korean civic and public organizations belonging to the People's Measure Council for Probing Truth about Burial of Defoliant accused the U.S. forces in south Korea of seeking to gloss over the investigation into the crimes related to the burial of defoliant. They held a seminar in Seoul on July 21.
					 The U.S. forces are going to finish the investigation into the burial of defoliant in their base in Waegwan only by confirming the burial of drums, speakers said.
					
					 The investigation should not be made in such a way as finding out drums only but checking all toxic materials contained in soil and underground water and looking into the damage done to inhabitants, they held.
					
					 They demanded the U.S. forces in south Korea open to the public all the reports about the results of the preceding investigations into environmental pollution in the military base in Waegwan.

articles.title: Overall Review of Motion Calling for Ratification of FTA Demanded in S. Korea
articles.content:
Overall Review of Motion Calling for Ratification of FTA Demanded in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, July 27 (KCNA) -- The south Korean paper Hangyore on July 20 carried an editorial titled "It is necessary to make overall review of south Korea-U.S. FTA".
					 The "Grand National Party" of south Korea said that it would certainly pass the "motion calling for the ratification of south Korea-U.S. FTA" through the extraordinary session of the "National Assembly" slated for August, the editorial said.
					
					 Contrary to this, the Democratic Party set forth the 12-point proposal for the review of the motion, it noted.
					
					 The motion is fraught with poisonous articles which may do unimaginable damage to the people's life, it said, stressing the need to make overall review of the motion.
					
					 If the ruling party railroads the motion defying the will of the opposition parties and the people, it would face stern judgment, it stressed.

articles.title: Russia Plans to Establish Aerospace Defense System
articles.content:
Russia Plans to Establish Aerospace Defense System
 Moscow, July 26 (KCNA) -- The commander of the Operation and Strategy Command for Aerospace Defense of Russia at a press conference on July 22 referred to the issue of establishing the aerospace defense system.
					 The aerospace defense system responsible for the defense of the whole territories of the country has been integrated, developed and modernized, he said. The system will be built by December this year on the basis of the command.
					
					 A flying corps tasked with air defense duty will be affiliated with the command, he added.

articles.title: Iranian FM Spokesman Criticizes West and Israel
articles.content:
Iranian FM Spokesman Criticizes West and Israel
 Tehran, July 26 (KCNA) -- An Iranian Foreign Ministry spokesman on July 21 accused the West of seeking to use human rights issue as a political leverage.
					 The West insists on the dispatch of a special rapporteur to Iran, while taking issue with its human rights issue. This is aimed to put political pressure upon Iran, the spokesman said.
					
					 He emphasized that the Iranian government would never accept the rapporteur.
					
					 The spokesman branded as an inhuman act the Israeli naval forces' interception of a foreign ship which was sailing to the Gaza Strip with humanitarian aid materials on board.

articles.title: Iranian President Calls for Unity of Independent Countries
articles.content:
Iranian President Calls for Unity of Independent Countries
 Tehran, July 26 (KCNA) -- Iranian President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad in a diplomatic appearance on July 23 called on the independent countries to get united to stand against the imperialists' policy of hegemonism.
					 Imperialism is nearing its end, he said, calling upon all the independent countries to boost cooperation and conduct vigorous actions against the imperialists' domination and interference.

articles.title: 6.5-magnitude Quake Hits Japan
articles.content:
6.5-magnitude Quake Hits Japan
 Pyongyang, July 27 (KCNA) -- An earthquake measuring 6.5 on the Richter scale jolted Japan's northeastern Miyagi Prefecture and its vicinity on Saturday.
					 The focus of the quake was located some 125 km off the coast of Sendai, Miyagi with a depth of 35.7 km under seabed.

articles.title: Drug Seized in France and Turkey
articles.content:
Drug Seized in France and Turkey
 Pyongyang, July 27 (KCNA) -- French customs have seized 250 kilograms of cocaine on a ship at the port of Dunkerque in northern France, local media reported on July 20.
					 Turkish police seized 83 kilograms of cocaine in southern Turkey on July 19, a report said, adding that three people were detained in the operation.

articles.title: S. Korean Opposition Party Accuses Ruling Party of Dictatorial Acts
articles.content:
S. Korean Opposition Party Accuses Ruling Party of Dictatorial Acts
 Pyongyang, July 27 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Democratic Labor Party of south Korea in a commentary on July 21 accused the "Grand National Party" of seeking to conclude the FTA with the U.S. at any cost.
					 That day the GNP representative demanded the passage of the "motion calling for the ratification of the FTA" through the extraordinary session of the "National Assembly" in August without fail, the commentary said, adding:
					
					 This is a declaration that they would conclude the FTA despite the people's protest.
					
					 The "motion", the worst shackling document, should never be allowed to pass as it would destroy south Korea's economy, the commentary noted.
					
					 The GNP's repeated dictatorial acts to railroad bills at the NA sessions, swimming against the south Koreans' mindset would only precipitate its destruction, it warned.

articles.title: Malaysian Deputy PM Hopes for Development of Relations with DPRK
articles.content:
Malaysian Deputy PM Hopes for Development of Relations with DPRK
 Pyongyang, July 27 (KCNA) -- Tan Seri Muhyidin Yassin, deputy prime minister who is also minister of Education of Malaysia, hoped the relations between Malaysia and the DPRK would grow stronger in various fields. He said this when meeting the DPRK delegation led by Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun Monday.
					 He said he was rejoiced over the successes made by the Korean people in the drive to develop the country and improve the standard of the people's living.

articles.title: China's State Council Calls for Boosting Land Management
articles.content:
China's State Council Calls for Boosting Land Management
 Beijing, July 26 (KCNA) -- China's State Council, in a statement released on July 20 after an executive meeting presided over by Premier Wen Jiabao, underscored the need to boost land management .
					 The statement called on local authorities to strictly supervise land use in line with rules and regulations, saying land use for major projects should be approved before construction starts.

articles.title: Iran's Supreme Leader Warns of Poisonous Books
articles.content:
Iran's Supreme Leader Warns of Poisonous Books 
 Tehran, July 26 (KCNA) -- Seyed Ali Khamenei, leader of the Islamic Revolution of Iran, in a recent address to librarians and publishers, urged censors to be vigilant against harmful and poisonous books.
					 "Not all books are necessarily good. Some books are like poisonous and addictive drugs," he said. "We should provide the people with healthy and good books."

articles.title: China Calls for Military-Government, Army-Civilian Unity
articles.content:
China Calls for Military-Government, Army-Civilian Unity 
 Beijing, July 26 (KCNA) -- Vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of China Xu Caihou, in a recent talk concerning the army's work with civilians, called for consolidating the unity between the military and government and between the army and civilians. 
					 He urged party officials at all levels to be deeply aware of the importance of the army's work with civilians and pay close attention to it, so as to promote the unity of the country and the harmony and stability of society.

articles.title: Reading Campaign Brisk among Young Chinese
articles.content:
Reading Campaign Brisk among Young Chinese 
 Beijing, July 26 (KCNA) -- A patriotic book reading campaign has been conducted among young Chinese people.
					 According to data released by the 18th national meeting for reviewing the campaign, a total of more than 600 million young people from across the country have taken part in the campaign over the last 18 years.
					
					 The campaign was launched in 1993 on the initiative of the All-China Women's Federation.

articles.title: Social Management Should be Based on Masses: Chinese Official
articles.content:
Social Management Should be Based on Masses: Chinese Official
 Beijing, July 26 (KCNA) -- Wang Lequa, deputy secretary of the Chinese Central Political and Legal Affairs Commission, recently called for creating an atmosphere favorable for all popular masses to participate in social management.
					 During his inspection tour of Zhejiang Province, he said that, in order to consolidate and develop social management, it is necessary to give importance to enlisting positive efforts and creativeness of broad masses and bring their role as the driving force into full play.

articles.title: Feats Praised by Indian Figure
articles.content:
Feats Praised by Indian Figure
 Pyongyang, July 27 (KCNA) -- Suneet Chopra, member of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of India (Marxist) who is secretary general of the All-India Indo-Korean Friendship Association, issued a statement on July 21 on the 58th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 July 27, 1953 was a significant day when the army and people of the DPRK defeated the U.S. imperialists in the three year-long fierce Fatherland Liberation War under the wise leadership of President Kim Il Sung, the statement said.
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK defended the independence of the country and the sovereignty of the nation from the imperialists' aggression, shattered to the smithereens the myth of the "mightiness" of the U.S. imperialists who had boasted of being the "strongest" in the world and brought about the beginning of a downhill turn for them, it noted.
					
					 The undying feats performed by the President in winning the war and the ever-victorious tradition of the Korean people are shining more brightly thanks to the Songun politics of general secretary Kim Jong Il, it said.
					
					 No force on earth can match the might of the single-hearted unity of the army and people of the DPRK rallied close around him, it stressed.

					 Chairman M. Jahangir Khan and other speakers said that Kim Jong Il in the work gave comprehensive and scientific answers to the issues of putting an end to the national division and achieving the country's reunification.
					
					 They explained that Kim Jong Il formulated the three principles of national reunification, the 10-point programme of the great unity of the whole nation and the proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo set forth by President Kim Il Sung as the three charters for national reunification. He also comprehensively and systematically dealt with the President's undying feats for the cause of the country's reunification, they added.
					
					 The DPRK's cause of independent reunification is sure to be achieved thanks to the outstanding idea and leadership of the illustrious commander of Songun, they said, expressing belief the Korean people would make greater achievements in their efforts for the country's reunification.

articles.title: Acuerdo de Armisticio y la Peninsula Coreana, comentario de la ATCC
articles.content:
Acuerdo de Armisticio y la Peninsula Coreana, comentario de la ATCC
 Pyongyang, 27 de julio (ATCC) -- El 27 de julio de hace 58 anos se ha firmado en Corea el Acuerdo de Armisticio. 
					 El inestable sistema de armisticio, que significa un alto al fuego temporal, vino impidiendo durante varios decenios la solucion pacifica del problema coreano y el proceso de desnuclearizacion de la Peninsula Coreana. 
					
					 Historicamente, los acuerdos de armisticio firmados en la Primera Guerra Mundial se convirtieron en el convenio de paz a los 6 meses o 2 anos, y los otros de la Segunda Guerra Mundial, a unos anos o dentro de 10 anos a mas tardar. 
					
					 Pero, el Acuerdo de Armisticio de Corea, residuo de la pasada guerra coreana, prolonga durante cerca de 60 anos el estado beligerante en la Peninsula Coreana. 
					
					 Hoy dia, el sistema de armisticio es la bomba de tiempo que amenaza constantemente la seguridad de Asia oriental y la region de Asia-Pacifico. 
					
					 En ninguna parte del mundo hay otra zona tan candente como esta region donde estan concentradas enormes fuerzas estrategicas y se desarrollan casi todos los dias las acciones militares, incluso los ejercicios conjuntos de guerra. 
					
					 En la Peninsula Coreana se mantiene a duras penas el estado de armisticio. Lo comprueba el hecho de que se ha convocado en cientos de ocasiones la reunion de la Comision Militar de Armisticio para tratar cientos de miles de casos de violacion del acuerdo de armisticio. 
					
					 En la region de Asia-Pacifico, centro estrategico del nuevo siglo, existe permanentemente el peligro de guerra, lo cual no conviene a la corriente principal de la epoca a la paz ni beneficia a nadie.
					
					 No se puede tolerar mas tal estado anormal. 
					
					 Para poner fin a la confrontacion y conflictos y preservar la paz duradera y la seguridad en la Peninsula Coreana, punto mas candente de la region, es preciso acabar con el estado de armisticio entre Corea y Estados Unidos y establecer el sistema de paz. 
					
					 La concertacion del convenio de paz sera el primer paso para la solucion del problema de la Peninsula Coreana, incluso la desnuclearizacion. 
					
					 En los tiempos pasados, una serie de negociaciones como las conversaciones a 6 bandas para la desnuclearizacion de la Peninsula Coreana, resultaron fracasadas porque no se supo que la clave de la solucion del problema de la Peninsula Coreana es el establecimiento del sistema de paz. 
					
					 Mientras que Corea y EE.UU., firmantes del acuerdo de armisticio, esten enfrentados con armas, no se podra eliminar nunca la desconfianza ni realizar sin complicaciones la desnuclearizacion. Esto es la leccion que ensenan las conversaciones a 6 bandas que sufrieron fracasos repetidos.
					
					 El punto esencial de la propuesta de la RPDC sobre el convenio de paz es acelerar la desnuclearizacion mediante la creacion de la confianza reciproca y la eliminacion del sistema de armisticio que fija y empeora institucionalmente las relaciones hostiles Corea-EE.UU.
					
					 La concertacion del convenio de paz es el inicio de la creacion de la confianza. Pues, sera una garantia institucional para eliminar la desconfianza y preparar las relaciones de respeto mutuo e igualdad entre ambas partes. 
					
					 En esta labor EE.UU. es el mas responsable que otros paises. 
					
					 El acuerdo de armisticio es el residuo de la guerra fria que persiguio EE.UU. con el fin de imponer a otra nacion la concepcion de valor y el regimen al estilo norteamericano. 
					
					 Hasta la fecha, como firmante de ese acuerdo, EE.UU. interviene en los asuntos coreanos y ejerce el control militar sobre el Sur de Corea. 
					
					 EE.UU. debe cumplir con toda su responsabilidad historica en la preservacion de la paz de la Peninsula Coreana. 
					
					 La situacion actual de la Peninsula Coreana en la encrucijada de distension o agravacion de tension demanda a los paises interesados que tomen la valiente decision de tocar el problema esencial aprovechando la oportunidad de dialogar. 
					
					 El problema de paz de la Peninsula Coreana se resolvera facilmente cuando EE.UU. evalue correctamente la situacion cambiada y la tendencia de desarrollo de la historia y tome la decision politica de modificar con audacia la politica sobre Corea, de acuerdo con los intereses propios y la aspiracion de los pueblos pacifistas del mundo. 
					
					 Este problema no se trata de hacer favor o recompensar por una parte a la otra, sino un tema politico fructifero que conviene por igual a la RPDC y EE.UU. y a la sociedad internacional y contribuira sustancialmente al desarrollo pacifico del mundo. 
					
					 La actitud y la posicion sobre la firma del convenio de paz determinaran si EE.UU., autodenominado como pais de Asia-Pacifico, tiene o no la voluntad de cumplir el papel responsable en resolver los urgentes problemas politicos de esta region, incluso la desnuclearizacion de la Peninsula Coreana.

articles.title: Ofrendas y cestos de flores ante cementerios y monumento a victoria
articles.content:
Ofrendas y cestos de flores ante cementerios y monumento a victoria 
 Pyongyang, 27 de julio (ATCC) -- En ocasion del 58o aniversario del triunfo en la gran Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria, fueron depositados el dia 27 ofrendas y cestos de flores ante el Cementerio de Martires Revolucionarios en el Monte Taesong, el Cementerio de Martires Patrioticos y el Monumento a la Victoria en la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria.
					 Estaban colocadas ante los cementerios mencionados las ofrendas florales enviadas por el Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea.
					
					 En las ocasiones estuvieron presentes los cuadros directivos del partido, el ejercito y el Estado, el presidente de partido amigo, los funcionarios de las instituciones del partido, las fuerzas armadas y el poder, organizaciones sociales, ministerios y organos centrales, los oficiales y soldados del Ejercito Popular de Corea y de las Fuerzas Populares del Interior de Corea, y los trabajadores.
					
					 Fueron depositados ante los cementerios las ofrendas florales a nombre del CC del PTC, el Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema y el Consejo de Ministros, de la RPDC, y un cesto de flores a nombre comun del CC y la Comision Militar Central del PTC ante la escultura "Victoria", tema principal del referido monumento.
					
					 En seguida, fueron colocados las ofrendas y cestos de flores a nombre del Ministerio de las Fuerzas Armadas Populares, el Ministerio de Seguridad del Pueblo, entidades sociales, ministerios, organos centrales, unidades del EPC y de las FPIC, instituciones de ciencia, educacion, salud publica, prensa e informacion, organismos del partido y el poder y granjas en la capital.
					
					 Por otra parte, tuvieron lugar semejantes actos ante las estatuas de bronce de los martires, los monumentos a los martires del EPC y las tumbas de estos en distintas partes del pais.
					
					 El mismo dia, el Cuerpo de Agregados Militares en Corea deposito ofrendas y cestos de flores ante el Cementerio de Martires Revolucionarios en el Monte Taesong y el Monumento a la Victoria en la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria.

articles.title: Periodicos llaman a glorificar la tradicion de victoria en guerra
articles.content:
Periodicos llaman a glorificar la tradicion de victoria en guerra 
 Pyongyang, 27 de julio (ATCC) -- El 27 de julio  de hace 58 anos el ejercito y el pueblo de Corea lograron la victoria historica en la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria contra los agresores norteamericanos que se jactaban  de la "supremacia" mundial. 
					 Con motivo de esa efemeride, los periodicos capitalinos publicaron sendos editoriales exhortando a glorificar mas la historia y la tradicion de la victoria en esa contienda antiyanqui. 
					
					 El diario Rodong Sinmun senala que la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria mostro claramente que siempre salen victoriosos el ejercito y el pueblo que luchan a riesgo de la vida para defender su idea,  regimen y causa bajo la guia de gran General insigne. 
					
					 La victoria en la pasada guerra coreana es el brillante fruto de la autoctona idea militar y metodos de combate y el destacado arte de mando militar del Presidente, ratifica y continua:
					
					 La historia mundial de guerras no conoce otro estratega militar y general invicto como el Presidente quien rechazo el ataque sorpresivo de los invasores con el contraataque inmediato, frustro con los ataques constantes a los enemigos de gran superioridad numerica y logro con iniciativa el triunfo de la guerra. 
					
					 Gracias al Presidente Kim Il Sung quien condujo a la victoria la guerra, el pueblo coreano pudo defender la valiosa patria rescatada por la lucha ensangrentada y exaltar a todo el mundo la dignidad del pueblo heroico que derroto a las fuerzas aliadas imperialistas. 
					
					 La historia de victoria lograda por el Presidente en la guerra se lleva delante de siglo en siglo por el Dirigente Kim Jong Il, General Insigne del Songun. 
					
					 Gracias a la extraordinaria inteligencia y el destacado arte de mando militar del Dirigente, el ejercito popular se ha fortalecido como invencibles fuerzas armadas revolucionarias, se ha consolidado mil veces la unidad monolitica, se ha preparado fuerte disuasivo de guerra y se ha convertido todo el pais en una fortaleza inexpugnable. 
					
					 El rotativo Minju Joson destaca que tener esa historia de relevante victoria lograda bajo la guia del gran lider y gran partido es un gran orgullo del ejercito y el pueblo de Corea, y apunta que saldra siempre victoriosa la RPDC que avanza con la bandera del Songun en alto.
